title: Personalized Nutrition Recommendation System
summary: Built intelligent system for personalized meal recommendations using reinforcement learning. Extracted and structured nutritional data for 200+ meals, implemented Q-learning and evolutionary algorithms for optimization, and integrated feedback loops for preference adaptation.
details:
‚Ä¢ Data Engineering: Extracted and structured nutritional data (calories, macronutrients, micronutrients) for 200+ meals from diverse sources
‚Ä¢ Recommendation Algorithm: Implemented Q-learning (Bellman equations) for optimal meal selection based on user preferences and nutritional goals
‚Ä¢ Evolutionary Optimization: Used genetic algorithms to explore diverse meal combinations and satisfy complex constraints
‚Ä¢ Feedback Integration: Built adaptive system that learns from user preferences (vegetarian, allergies, macronutrient targets) to improve recommendations over time
‚Ä¢ Evaluation: Achieved high relevance scores and user satisfaction in testing phase

title: IMA 205 ‚Äî Cardiac MRI Diagnosis (Kaggle Competition)
summary: üèÜ 1st Place among 100 participants. Built end-to-end medical imaging pipeline with advanced segmentation, radiomics feature extraction, and ensemble classification achieving 95% train and 81% validation accuracy.
details:
‚Ä¢ Segmentation Pipeline: Applied state-of-the-art architectures (U-Net, SegNet, Segment Anything Model) for cardiac structure segmentation from MRI
‚Ä¢ Feature Engineering: Implemented PyRadiomics extraction pipeline to compute 100+ radiomics features capturing texture, shape, and intensity patterns
‚Ä¢ ETL Pipeline: Built robust data processing workflow with validation, normalization, and quality checks
‚Ä¢ Ensemble Methods: Trained multiple classifiers (LightGBM, XGBoost, Autoencoder-SVM) and implemented stacking for robust predictions
‚Ä¢ Performance: Achieved 95% training accuracy and 81% validation accuracy, winning competition against 100 teams
‚Ä¢ Impact: Demonstrated advanced ML techniques in medical imaging for improved diagnostic accuracy

title: Tick Tick Bloom ‚Äî NASA Algal Bloom Detection (DrivenData)
summary: ü•â Ranked 50th out of 1,377 participants. Processed multi-spectral satellite imagery (Sentinel-2, Landsat) and optimized LightGBM with Optuna achieving AggRMSE of 1.0536.
details:
‚Ä¢ Remote Sensing: Processed multi-band Sentinel-2 and Landsat satellite imagery for global algal bloom detection
‚Ä¢ Feature Engineering: Extracted spectral indices (NDVI, chlorophyll anomalies) and temporal patterns from time series data
‚Ä¢ Hyperparameter Optimization: Used Optuna for Bayesian optimization of LightGBM parameters with cross-validation
‚Ä¢ Model Performance: Achieved AggRMSE of 1.0536, demonstrating strong predictive accuracy across diverse geographic regions
‚Ä¢ Competition Performance: Ranked 50/1377 participants, top 3.6% of competition
‚Ä¢ Real-World Impact: Contributed to improved early detection of harmful algal blooms for environmental monitoring

title: Embedded Gait Analysis System ‚Äî Deep Learning on Edge
summary: Designed and deployed embedded gait analysis system on Arduino Nano 33 with IMU sensors. Used denoising autoencoders and deep learning (GRU, LSTM, Transformers) for knee angle prediction, improving accuracy by ~20%.
details:
‚Ä¢ Hardware Integration: Interfaced Arduino Nano 33 IoT with MPU-9250 IMU sensors for real-time motion capture
‚Ä¢ Signal Processing: Implemented sensor fusion algorithms to combine accelerometer, gyroscope, and magnetometer data
‚Ä¢ Denoising: Built denoising autoencoders to remove sensor noise and improve signal quality (+20% accuracy improvement)
‚Ä¢ Deep Learning Models: Implemented multiple architectures (GRU, LSTM, Transformer) for time series prediction of knee angles
‚Ä¢ Hyperparameter Tuning: Used Optuna and GridSearchCV for architecture and parameter optimization
‚Ä¢ Experiment Tracking: Tracked 100+ experiments with Weights & Biases for reproducibility and insights
‚Ä¢ Deployment: Optimized models for embedded systems with reduced memory footprint
‚Ä¢ Applications: Bionic leg control, rehabilitation monitoring, sports biomechanics analysis

title: FinOps Multi-Agent Assistant with LLMs
summary: Built intelligent FinOps assistant using LangGraph for multi-agent orchestration. Optimized long-term memory for multi-turn financial dialogues and deployed on AWS with CI/CD pipelines.
details:
‚Ä¢ Multi-Agent Architecture: Designed modular multi-agent system with LangGraph for cost analysis, optimization recommendations, and budget planning
‚Ä¢ Long-Term Memory: Optimized memory management for maintaining context across 50+ turn conversations about financial workflows
‚Ä¢ LLM Integration: Leveraged Claude/GPT-4 APIs with custom prompting strategies for financial domain accuracy
‚Ä¢ AWS Deployment: Deployed using Lambda (serverless functions), S3 (data storage), Bedrock (LLM API), with auto-scaling
‚Ä¢ CI/CD Pipeline: Implemented automated testing, staging, and production deployment workflows
‚Ä¢ Cost Optimization: Reduced API costs by 30% through prompt optimization and caching strategies
‚Ä¢ User Interface: Built conversational interface for cloud cost analysis and optimization recommendations
